definition[0]: to make a bundle by tying things together
example[0]: Bundle up the newspapers and take them to the skip.
definition[1]: to put different things together so that they are dealt with at the same time
example[1]: The lawsuit bundles together the claims of many individuals into one big case.
definition[2]: to put warm clothes on someone or yourself because it is cold
example[2]: People sat bundled up in scarves, coats, and boots.
example[3]: spectators bundled up against the cold
